name: cornishman
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a man from the county (= area with its own local government) of Cornwall in southwestern England: William was a Cornishman, born near Penzance. I came to Cornwall because I married a Cornishman. The hero of the story is a Cornishman who flees to the United States, escaping a complicated life back home.
More examplesFewer examplesMy family home is in Cornwall and even though I consider myself a passionate Cornishman, I rarely manage to go back there.My dad was a typical, old-fashioned Cornishman.She met her husband, a Cornishman, at the Royal College of Art and they married four years later.He plays a Cornishman who leaves London and returns to his roots.
